archive_id.WCRP: a collection of datasets from the AMIP and CMIP project phases, along with project supporting datasets from the input4MIPs (forcing datasets used to drive CMIP simulations) and obs4MIPs (observational datasets used to evaluate CMIP simulations, and numerous other supporting activities

area_label.lus: sector (auxiliary coordinate for land-use area types

1pctCO2.experiment: 1 percent per year increase in CO2

1hrCM.description: monthly-mean diurnal cycle resolving each day into 1-hour means

grid_label.gn: data reported on a model's native grid
grid_label.gna: data reported on a native grid in the region of Antarctica
grid_label.gng: data reported on a native grid in the region of Greenland
grid_label.gnz: zonal mean data reported on a model's native latitude grid
grid_label.gr: regridded data reported on the data provider's preferred target grid
grid_label.gra: regridded data in the region of Antarctica reported on the data provider's preferred target grid
grid_label.grg: regridded data in the region of Greenland reported on the data provider's preferred target grid
grid_label.grz: regridded zonal mean data reported on the data provider's preferred latitude target grid

institution_id.PCMDI: Program for Climate Model Diagnosis and Intercomparison, Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, Livermore, CA 94550, USA

region.ant: located around the South Pole, separated from other land masses by the Southern Ocean, and almost entirely south of 60 degrees South latitude
region.glb: the complete Earth surface, 90 degrees North to 90 degrees South latitude, and all longitudes
region.gre: located in the Northern Atlantic Ocean, separated from other land masses by the Labrador Sea and Straits, and almost entirely north of 60 degrees North latitude
region.nhem: the complete Earth surface from the equator to the North Pole, 0 to 90 degrees North latitude
region.shem: the complete Earth surface from the equator to the South Pole, 0 to 90 degrees South latitude

PCMDI-test-1-0.label: PCMDI-test 1.0
PCMDI-test-1-0.label_extended: PCMDI-test 1.0 (This entry is free text for users to contribute verbose information)

atmos.description: Earth1.0-gettingHotter (360 x 180 longitude/latitude; 50 levels; top level 0.1 mb)

ocean.description: BlueMarble1.0-warming (360 x 180 longitude/latitude; 50 levels; top grid cell 0-10 m)

PCMDI-test-1-0.source:
PCMDI-test 1.0 (1989): 
aerosol: none
atmos: Earth1.0-gettingHotter (360 x 180 longitude/latitude; 50 levels; top level 0.1 mb)
atmosChem: none
land: Earth1.0
landIce: none
ocean: BlueMarble1.0-warming (360 x 180 longitude/latitude; 50 levels; top grid cell 0-10 m)
ocnBgchem: none
seaIce: Declining1.0-warming (360 x 180 longitude/latitude)

source_type.AER: aerosol treatment in an atmospheric model where concentrations are calculated based on emissions, transformation, and removal processes (rather than being prescribed or omitted entirely)
source_type.AGCM: atmospheric general circulation model run with prescribed ocean surface conditions and usually a model of the land surface
source_type.AOGCM: coupled atmosphere-ocean global climate model, additionally including explicit representation of at least the land and sea ice
source_type.BGC: biogeochemistry model component that at the very least accounts for carbon reservoirs and fluxes in the atmosphere, terrestrial biosphere, and ocean
source_type.CHEM: chemistry treatment in an atmospheric model that calculates atmospheric oxidant concentrations (including at least ozone), rather than prescribing them
source_type.LAND: land model run uncoupled from the atmosphere
source_type.OGCM: ocean general circulation model run uncoupled from an AGCM but, usually including a sea-ice model
source_type.RAD: radiation component of an atmospheric model run 'offline'
source_type.SLAB: slab-ocean used with an AGCM in representing the atmosphere-ocean coupled system
